intro: Scirpidium tenue, commonly known as the slender scirpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands in suitable habitats. Scirpidium tenue plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
